Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fibrin Glue Sealant in Liver Resection

Trial_Design.evidence: 300 patients undergoing hepatic resection were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either fibrin glue application or standard care (control)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraoperative blood loss.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 150 patients were allocated to each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: analysis conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in transfusion requirements (0.15 ± 0.66 vs. 0.17 ± 0.63 PRCU; P = 0.7234)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported in either group.
